required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Proof-of-Concept Trial on Selective Removal of sFlt-1 in Pregnant Women With Preeclampsia Via Apheresis
clinical_study.official_title: Proof-of-Concept Trial on Selective Removal of the Antiangiogenic Factor Soluble Fms-like Tyrosine Kinase-1 (sFlt-1) in Pregnant Women With Preeclampsia Via Apheresis Utilizing the Flt-1 Adsorption Column

brief_summary.textblock: This clinical investigation is a medical device trial to examine the safety and efficacy of TheraSorb sFlt-1 adsorber treatment of pregnant patients with preeclampsia.

primary_outcome.measure: Occurrence of AEs and SAEs in healthy volunteers until the 2 weeks follow-up (Phase 0)
Occurrence of AEs and SAEs in pregnant subjects and the fetus or infant until the 6 weeks post-delivery visit is reached (Phase A-B).

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 0: Determine changes of sFlt-1 levels.
Phase 0: Complement activation levels pre-, during and post apheresis.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Before, during and directly following the performance of the single apheresis treatment (1 day)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phase 0: Concentration of antibody leaching during an apheresis procedure
Phase 0: Change of HAMA levels in pre- and post apheresis blood
Phase A/B: Occurrence of SAEs in the one year follow-up period
Phases A/B: Evaluate antibody leaching in phase A.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: During the performance of the single apheresis treatment in Phase A (1 day) as well as pre and 3hrs post apheresis

secondary_outcome.measure: Phases A and B: Evaluate maternal sFlt-1 levels.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Constant measures throughout the trial until delivery (up to 19 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phases A/B: Evaluate the sFlt-1/PlGF ratio.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Constant measures throughout the trial until delivery (up to 19 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phases A/B:Evaluate neonatal umbilical cord blood sFlt-1 levels at birth.
Phases A/B: Time and method of delivery, and anesthesia administered
Phases A and B: Determine the post-partum maternal and neonatal length of hospitalization.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Following birth up to one year

secondary_outcome.measure: Phases A/B: Evaluate standard markers of fetal development throughout pregnancy.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From start of trial until delivery (up to 19 weeks)

secondary_outcome.measure: Phases A/B: Evaluate standard markers of neonatal development.
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Directly following delivery until end of FU (1 year)

arm_group.description: Phase 0 is an initial safety phase where subjects will undergo one single TheraSorb sFlt-1 adsorber apheresis procedure.
Phase A is a safety and dose-finding phase during which pregnant women diagnosed with preeclampsia will undergo one single TheraSorb sFlt-1 adsorber apheresis procedure.
Phase B is a safety and efficacy phase during which pregnant women diagnosed with preeclampsia will undergo TheraSorb sFlt-1 adsorber apheresis procedures up to twice weekly.

intervention.description: Removal of excessive sFlt-1 from the plasma of subjects/ patients with therapeutic apheresis.

overall_official.affiliation: Cambridge Clinical Trials Unit Addenbrooke's Hospital

facility.name: Cambridge Clinical Trials Unit, Addenbrooke's Hospital
Oxford Radcliffe Hospitals Nhs, John Radcliffe Hospital
